summary: New PSD pubic hair alternatives for CBBE.
descriptionHtml:
I have included new pubic hair PSDs for you to use with your CBBE body. This mod is for those of you who likes a more \"natural\" look. Shaved is boring :(

Files:
MorecbbePubicHair01 - Smaller and thicker patch of hair.
MorecbbePubicHair02 - Large patch of hair covering part of the stomach.
MorecbbePubicHair03 - Balanced patch of hair covering only the pubic area.

Requirements:
1. CBBE - http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/mods/2666
2. Textblend - http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/mods/5737
3. Any \"shaved\" CBBE compatible texture in order to avoid \"stacking\" this texture on top.
4. Make sure you have installed CBBE + any body texture before beginning with installation of this mod.

Install:
0. Backup your \\Data\\textures\\actors\\character\\female\\femalebody_1.dds (this is the file being modified)
1. Unrar and Copy the PSDs to your textblend folder inside \\Library\\Body and Feet\\Color\\PubicHair
2. Open textblend and select Set: \"Body and Feet\" and then Type: \"Color\".
3. Scroll down and double click on one of the downloaded pubic hair textures to load it into \"preview\".
4. Click Blend Images.
5. Done.

Mods used in images:
CBBE + custom bodyslide
Sunburn - http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/mods/14322
Sweaty Body CBBE1 - http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/mods/19666
Stockings - http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/mods/25389
Zaz Resources - Whips Restraints and Bondage - http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/mods/24023 *** Higly Recommended ***
And a body moles mod I can\'t remember the name of.

You may also take a look at this optional, but great tan lines mod: 
http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/mods/27466

If you are looking for another realism body mod I would suggest taking a look at:
4uDIKs Real body - http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/mods/6667
It\'s an entire body mod and not compatible with cbbe or unp, but very well done.

Message to other texture modders:
I would love to see more pubic hair mods with different types of hair (curly, semi-curly etc..)
If you plan to make a mod then I would suggest that one of them should cover the same area as my 03-version. There are far too many thin and nearly clean shaven mods out there and that\'s not really how it\'s supposed to look if going for realism. I suggest taking a look at playboy 1980-1992 to see the complexity of the hair.

Credits:
Caliente for creating a fantastic body mod and texture blender.
All body texture modders for doing a great work.
All other Skyrim modders.
and [url=http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/mods/26393]Vilja[/url] for being a good sport by modelling the new hairstyles! :)
author: Mambo
